auth0-jwt-auth-inbound.title: Auth0 JWT Auth
auth0-jwt-auth-inbound.description: Authenticate users using Auth0 issued JWT tokens.

allowUnauthenticatedRequests.description: Allow unauthenticated requests to proceed. This is use useful if you want to use multiple authentication policies or if you want to allow both authenticated and non-authenticated traffic.

audience.description: The Auth0 audience of your API, for example https://api.example.com/

cognito-jwt-auth-inbound.title: AWS Cognito JWT Auth
cognito-jwt-auth-inbound.description: Authenticate users using AWS Cognito issued JWT tokens.

allowUnauthenticatedRequests.description: Allow unauthenticated requests to proceed. This is use useful if you want to use multiple authentication policies or if you want to allow both authenticated and non-authenticated traffic.

region.description: The AWS region where your Cognito instance is deployed

rate-limit-inbound.title: Rate Limit Inbound
rate-limit-inbound.description: The rate-limiting policy is used to limit the number of requests that can be made against your API based on a key.

rateLimitBy.description: The identifying element of the request that enforces distinct rate limits. For example, you can limit by user, ip, function or all - function allows you to specify a simple function to create a string identifier to create a rate-limit group

requestsAllowed.description: The max number of requests allowed in the given time window

timeWindowMinutes.description: The time window in which the requests are rate-limited. The count restarts after each window expires

identifier.description: The function that returns dynamic configuration data. Used only with rateLimitBy=function

export.description: used only with rateLimitBy=function. Specifies the export to load your custom bucket function, e.g. default, rateLimitIdentifier.

module.description: Specifies the module to load your custom bucket function, in the format $import(./modules/my-module)

acl-policy-inbound.title: Access Control List Inbound
acl-policy-inbound.description: The access control list inbound policy limits access to resources based on parameters of the request

policies.description: The policies to enforce for the request

export.description: Specifies the export to load your function, e.g. `default`, `myFunction`.

module.description: Specifies the module to load your function, in the format `$import(./modules/my-module)`

audit-log-inbound.title: Audit Logs Inbound
audit-log-inbound.description: Capture detailed logs of requests for auditing purposes

logIpAddress.description: if the IP address should be logged

logGeolocation.description: if the geolocation information should be logged (i.e. state, country, longitude, latitude, etc.)

tenant.description: if the route parameters should be logged (i.e. the value of customerId in the route /customers/:customerId)

metadata.description: A function to add additional data to the audit logs

export.description: Specifies the export to load your function, e.g. default, myFunction.

module.description: Specifies the module to load your function, in the format $import(./modules/my-module)

ab-test-inbound.title: A/B Test Inbound
ab-test-inbound.description: The A/B test policy is used to handle requests differently based on parameters such as user, ip, etc.

testKey.description: The key to use for determining the group the request belongs

modifier.description: The function that modifies the request based on the test key

export.description: Specifies the export to load your function, e.g. default, myFunction.

module.description: Specifies the module to load your function, in the format $import(./modules/my-module)
